author: Charm Golden
text: 'I had read about the heated igloos at this location it‚Äôs actually featured as a must do in the area .. my husband and I stopped in too get the igloo experience on the roof. An older grey haired man came too take us upstairs as I was getting a call as we were walking that my mother was being rushed too the ER. This grey haired man then took the opportunity too completely disrespect my husband about our choice of sitting on the roof ‚Ä¶ he said we could not have the igloos they were reserved for the night and kept saying ‚Äúyou know it‚Äôs cold right?‚Äù  He even went as far too say too my husband who is a black man ‚Äúyou people amaze me ‚Äú .. what does that mean .. then slammed us down ..in some dark area .. I am absolutely upset at this .. we were there November 16th 2021 in the evening .. the man was very rude..'

author: karisma kaye
text: "I've recently moved to jersey city and have read mixed reviews about iron monkey
column5: but their menu was enticing so I decided to give it a shot.\nBY ALL MEANS REFRAIN FROM COMING TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT! I came for drinks and received minimum service. We ordered a salad to start and the Cesar salad was overdressed and steak was under cooked. Trying to be optimistic- we ordered beer and whiskey. After hearing conversations with other patrons who were not satisfied with the bill
column6: we were curious to see what ours was. Jameson on the rocks (which was poured half a shot with ice) was under poured and charged $13.00!!!!!! Cesar salad alone was $20!!! The prices did not match the menu. Overall I will never come back
column7: the service was minimal and their prices did not equate to an actual drink. I basically paid for $130 for ice and no steak."

author: Andrew Chui
text: 'Are you guys kidding me? Did the delivery man eat my order? $16 for 15 small pieces of calamari? Can‚Äôt even fill half the box? How cheap can you be?\n\nFood isn‚Äôt even that great. Definitely not worth the price. I‚Äôd say go elsewhere.'

author: Gavri k
text: 'Great place but expensive'

author: Dan Jackiewicz (DANMAN)
text: 'Friendly owner and staff. Cool environment and fun music.'

author: Debora Rueda
text: 'That restaurant is the best
column5: the food and services üëç I like the bubbles I think was very nice and creative idea.'

author: Janine Johnson
text: 'I was there for a party and I have to be honest.  The food was terrible.  We had appetizers.  Every single one was either overcooked or just not tasty.  The calamari were like pieces of rock and some pieces were burnt.  Tater tots were also hard as rocks.  The drinks were ok hough and staff was friendly.'

author: Ketaki Kulkarni
text: "And again
column5: they change their chef. The menu is changed. The sandwiches are awful!! So awful that I'm not a great cook but I can make better sandwiches than this chef.\n\nThe precious menu was awesome
column6: the food was delicious. Their chicken schnitzel and meatballs were mouth watering!\n\nThe problem with this place is
column7: the owner cannot sustain one chef or bartenders for a long time. I had stopped visiting this place since 2018 to summer 2020. When they opened it for take out during summer 2020
column8: they had a new chef and the food was great! But seems like they just changed their chef recently
column9: and I doubt if he's even a chef. Stay away
column10: until further updates on the new chef."

author: Y V
text: 'Enjoyed the vibe and crowd but disliked the music (too loud for me). Tasty food and pleasant service.'

author: Bhavik Sharma
text: 'Awesome place. I regret not discovering this earlier. The roof top is great
column5: service is good.'

author: Amel Perez
text: 'The worst place to eat...bad food quality and even bad service'

author: kerlyn s
text: 'this is by far the worst place i‚Äôve gone to. my friends & i waited 1 hour and a half for some chicken wings. the waitress was rude & had attitude & she charged extra. the food was cold & terrible. i DO NOT recommend coming here. i‚Äôm never coming back\nto clarify a few things YOU mentioned\nmy chicken wings DID take an hour and a half‚Ä¶ we DID speak to the manager & they spoke to our server. that‚Äôs when she came back with a nasty attitude. how would you ‚Äúspeak to your server‚Äù if i never mentioned which server? considering the fact that you have a lot of reviews like mine
column5: is a restaurant problem that needs to be fixed‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt try to correct & say my food didn‚Äôt take long.'

author: Brielle Burton
text: 'I went to the iron monkey with a group of my friends we got sat down pretty quickly and ordered our food. after waiting for about an hour for food we talked to our server asking where our food is and she said that she would check and she never came back to us. then after waiting for another half an hour we decided to speak to a manager about where our food is and they explained that their kitchen was having trouble tonight. at first our waitress was very friendly and helpful but as soon as we started getting annoyed with the fact that we haven‚Äôt received our food for over an hour and 30 minutes she became disrespectful and had a terrible attitude towards us. my friend also wrote a review about our experience and the staff at the iron monkey basically told her that she was making stuff up and was telling her that the waitress never had an attitude with us. As someone who goes out to eat regularly I have been to places where the food is not to expectation and usually when I leave a review the management is quite nice with their feedback and what they have to say and I was really disappointed with what they said to my friend and honestly I think was disrespectful. I will not be coming back and I do not recommend. our server was stacey m.'

author: Dena N.
text: "Not pleased with my experience at this bar. Came for happy hour and opted for outdoor seating. Ordered a peach sangria which was ok but before ordering food
column5: our waitress Iryna informed us that she would need to have our method of payment beforehand.  She stated that this was a new policy implemented by the bar
column6: to ensure that guests don't walk out on their bill. Others who have visited this establishment have said that this was never required of them
column7: which made me suspicious.  Not sure what to think of this place. Decided in that moment that I didn't want to stay
column8: paid for my drinks and ate lunch elsewhere. Wondering if this is a requirement for all of their customers......"

author: Baker Jeff
text: 'Always a great time there.... Drinks made great and atmosphere was nice and relaxing....'

author: Xauen Zirpolo
text: "While the atmosphere is top-notch
column5: with 3 floors and rooftop space aplenty
column6: everything else is very underwhelming. Food was...okay
column7: draft list was...okay
column8: prices were...okay. Not a bad spot by any means but you won't be impressed by anything but the space"

author: Chirag Khushalani
text: "Our waitress was maybe having a bad day
column5: she didn't seem to care at all."

author: Dwayne Stephens
text: 'Excellent üëå'

author: Rohan Kulkarni
text: 'This place is charging money incorrectly unbeknownst to customers. I ordered over a call. And I was charged money for options which on Grubhub and Doordash are free.\n\nWhen I asked about this
column5: they refunded the amount. But it definitely seemed like a normal practice for them. Pickup order took 45 mins and I was told 15 mins pickup time.\n\nI dont like it when I am duped. Plain and simple. Sorry
column6: not going to order again.'

author: Ian Gordon
text: "The rooftop is sick
column5: but the service is pretty terrible. Our server didn't write down any of our orders
column6: we had 3-4 different people helping us throughout the meal and when we got the bill they charged us for 2 drinks we did not order or receive. When I called the next day to get a refund
column7: the Asst Mgr assured me they would refund me and never did. I called 3-5 more times
column8: only to get no answer and redirected to a voicemail box that was different from the one I had been calling. It's a shame the management here is poor because the food and atmosphere were amazing. Definitely going to think twice before returning here and definitely will be checking the bill at the table!"

author: Sandy Smith
text: 'Enjoyed it.  There was a wait for the rooftop dining
column5: about 20 minutes
column6: we sat outside for the wait
column7: service was excellent
column8: young man with the dreads was the best
column9: he made it feel personal really personal
column10: he went above & beyond with a beautiful smile
column11: food was good.  Entire place was clean

author: Gina Dawson
text: 'Nachos delish! My niece had this pb & j and loved the actual peanuts!'

author: Paul Guevara
text: 'It is really cool!  The art
column5: the taps on the walls. Good and beers were very tasty'

author: Sandy Johnston
text: 'I had a wonderful 1st time there.  I will love to go back and the finger food was good.'

author: Dena H.
text: 'I wish the money I spent here was used somewhere else. The sangria was probably the best part of the meal besides all the fruit flies that were on the fruit.\n\nThe loaded tater tots tasted off
column5:
lack of flavoring or something was missing.

The meatballs were decent but the garlic bread were like crisps not bread so it was slightly misleading.

If I were to come back it would only be for drinks.'

author: Promise Marks
text: "Great place excellent drinks tasty appetizers lots of fun all on the roof top. I'll definitely go back to this again"

author: Maddy
text: 'The food is not the best here nor the drinks.. but the rooftop is pretty at night..'

author: dave craigg
text: 'Had a late night snack and drinks around 1 am. Very friendly staff. Sliders and wings were great.  Rooftop is pretty cool.'

author: Meghna Veer Kaushik
text: "Great food.... the AC was off which was shocking considering we're in a heat wave. But otherwise excellent location and good service."

author: Andrew Davidson
text: 'Would not return for food
column5: but the drinks were okay.'

author: Jossue Ciancaglini
text: 'Great servicw from Santina'

author: Luis Padilla
text: 'Santina on the roof top was amazing. My party had an absolutely amazing time. Please just give her a raise now. This is the type of employee that you want to reward for treating guests with such above and beyond service. I highly recommend the blue monkey margarita
column5: 10/10 service and quality. Thank you so much!'

author: Fabiola Marquez
text: 'A wonderful rooftop extra experience with the best server/bartender Santina
column5: we appreciate her tons'

author: Isaac Andrade
text: 'Food and drinks were popping. Santina was our main bartender n she made sure we had a great time!!'

author: Martha Devia
text: 'Santina was an amazing bartender and server it was our first visit and she made us feel so at home. Great apps even greater drinks 5 stars!!'

author: Rahul Kochar
text: 'Good menu
column5: good food
column6: good vibe. Pretty good jc hangout and date spot.'

author: Jacqueline Romirer
text: 'Lovely Pub
column5: narrow building
column6: but rooftop on the 4th floor. Nice selection of draft beers and cocktails
column7: as well as food. Great and attentive staff
column8: oldschool vibe. My favourite pub in the area!'

author: Jim a
text: 'Good place stuff for cold beer drink. Had some wings. Staff was friendly.'

author: Shailaja Ponnaganti
text: 'Love them Beers and Great Food.'

author: Leo Rugel
text: "What a disappointment
column5: I wait literally 4 hours for 2 hamburgers and 1 appetizer. I just had to leave because I wasn't waiting more for just 2 simple burgers. This used to be my favorite place in all downtown but I'll never come back."

author: Ryan ‚ÄúChubz‚Äù Oneill
text: "Service was bare minimum even on a slow day. Cool small rooftop location. Priced reasonably. To access the rooftop it's 3 flights up of stairs so beware."

author: Nina
text: 'Cute dive bar with friendly staff and great food!'

author: Troy Chavers
text: 'Untrained bartenders..'

author: jenny rose sindon
text: 'My sister throw a surprise ü•≥.  It was awesome!'

author: Vicki Edgar
text: 'Super cool rooftop patio.  Chill vibe. Great beers and great food.  Was a good night.'

author: Teagan Hammond
text: 'Cool vibe
column5: with a mix of an English/Irish pub and a tropical drink selection.'

author: Champagne Chalet
text: 'This place is always spot on. Great food and drinks.'

author: Theresa Aslin
text: 'Lots to like about this place from beer selection to the decor to the food. I\'m from the west coast
column5: so the "old"
column6: (we\'ll say "restored") decor was charming. This place has four levels. The ground floor
column7: the second floor and the fourth floor (rooftop) all have bars and the third floor is the kitchen. The rooftop is covered with flowers and potted plants. It has a nice view of the Hudson. They had some unique beers that were very good. As for food we just had chips and guac
column8: but the guac was a very generous portion. They have all sorts of other options. There isn\'t too much around here
column9: so it was a great find.'

author: Damian Harewood
text: "Depending on what you get
column5:
the fries are sometimes cold because they take forever to bring them to your table.
Sometimes the wings are eh over cooked

Other than that it's an OK place"

author: Swati Dhawan
text: 'Love the roof top!'

author: Mia Abigail
text: 'Liked being at the rooftop. Good choices of food and drinks'

author: Yun Chun Venus Chua
text: 'Had the best time! With great service from Bill and Santina! Great servers and such fun people! Will definitely be back!!! Great great staff\nBeer is good too! Thank you for the recommendations! All en pointe!'

author: Jason Celik
text: 'Great establishment'

author: Laura Hansen
text: 'Sat under one of the tents on the roof because it started raining. Water started to collect in a corner of the tent
column5: so one of the bartenders came over with a stick to kick out the water. The water poured all over us
column6: our food
column7: our phones
column8: and my purse. We were still required to pay the full tab. We also didn‚Äôt receive an apology from the bartender. This is the worst restaurant experience I‚Äôve ever had.'

author: A H
text: "Crowd was fine
column5: bar is dated and goes from tacky whacky to kind chill on the roof
column6: food was good
column7: beers were great
column8: anytime I overheard the manger she was talking about her wife or attempting to flirt with the females around instead of checking on our table because we had an angsty teen for a server that didn't want to be there. My work buddies seem to enjoy themselves and love a Scottish bartender and some kid who quit/fired but I haven't had the pleasure. We're heading in tonight after work so I'll update this review then and cross my fingers we get the right server. Definitely better rooftops to spend money at unless you need a particular beer they have on tap or work right around the corner like me.\n\nUPDATE! While I appreciate the timely response from mgmt below - my friends and I were stuck in the corner of an overcrowded bar and asked to wait for further instructions. Not one person knew what was going on and the manager was huffing around not helping the situation at all. We patiently waited and then were told we couldn't go upstairs without closing our tab. We should have been warned about that before sitting and no one wants multiple charges on their cards. By the time we got upstairs the infamous Scot was PO and yelling at everyone in sight. It was mildly entertaining but still. Sorry if the pandemic took your good staff but that's no excuse for the way your current staff operate. Probably try closing for a week or two with intensive training and a deep scrub."

author: Jack Pitts
text: 'Heard Great things. Essentially neglected after being seated. Thanks for nothing'

author: Rae Z
text: 'First time diner
column5: multiple time orderer since we moved to Jersey City! Andrew is amazing! LOVED the mashed potatoes! Great service!!! Thank you!!!'

author: PiscesMuse
text: 'No room and ugly people. It is a basic straight bar. I will say the waiter was lovely though.'

author: stony1234511
text: 'Went here for the first time the other night. I completely understand that with Covid there are staffing shortages and training learning curves
column5: but the wait time was over two hours for a couple of drinks/food and the place was not very busy.\n\nThis place does have a great beer selection and wonderful rooftop seating area
column6: but after the first round of drinks
column7: we did not see or have any contact from our waiter or any other staff for over 30 minutes. Normally I would completely understand considering our waiter probably had other tables and looked to be in training
column8: but the place did not seem to be busy (plenty of open tables) and there were other staff walking by and standing around the rooftop seating area who made eye contact with our empty drink glasses several times but never came over to offer refills or check in on us. It‚Äôs a shame because I would have gladly ordered a few more rounds to further patronize the business.\n\nThe food was decent
column9: but a bit pricey for what you get. Drink prices were comparable to other places in the area.\n\nI‚Äôm not writing this review to tell anyone to not at least give this place a shot if you‚Äôre in the area (there‚Äôs a lot of potential for growth and I will be back for a second chance) but I‚Äôm hoping management will take my shared experience and hopefully use it to help make the business stronger during these tough times.'

author: Mahesh K
text: "Rooftop is the place you want to be at this place. I've been coming to this place for few years now. The drinks like margaritas and cocktails are generally good. They also serve food as well."

author: H Gupta
text: 'Great place to eat! Amazing drink menu!'

author: Romano Almonte
text: 'Wide selection of craft beers
column5: the wife enjoyed the margaritas and the truffle fries. Sat on the rooftop bar.'

author: roshani joshi
text: 'Amazing staff
column5: food and drinks. Lively ambience'

author: Luis Rodriguez (Archi_user1234)
text: 'Food was okay. But drinks were great.\nSmall rooftop but it is nice to get away from the sounds below.'

author: Joe Das
text: "Cozy little bar with a nice rooftop and outside seating. Delicious food
column5: nice ambience. Whether you sit inside or outside
column6: it's a pleasurable experience. I'll say our experience was enhanced by the amazing service and congeniality of the bartenders who were great to talk to
column7: AND made superb drinks. We were glad to give it a try
column8: and will definitely be going there often."

author: Kesavanand M
text: 'One of the best places in downtown Jersey City for Friday/Saturday night catchups.'

author: Raymond Riepel
text: 'VERY CLEAN AND VERY RESPECTFUL'

author: Eugenia Kim
text: 'It‚Äôs the beginning of June and the AC does not work indoors. Recommend outdoor dining at least you will feel the cooler air. The host and server were friendly. Service is kind of slow but we did get our order eventually.'

author: Michael Sanchez
text: 'Great bartenders. Great service. And the owner Steve is that dude!'

author: Tenzin Sangay
text: 'IRON MONKEY! The chillest bar in town with the best music and good food. What more can a man ask for'

author: Liam Donovan
text: "Had a lovely night time date on the roof recently. Extensive food menu and interesting cocktails
column5: everything we had was tasty.\nOnly real issue was staffing related. Seems our waitresses shift ended shortly after we arrived
column6: and afterwards it was unclear who would be serving us. From there it seemed there was only one waitress covering the roof section
column7: which had gotten fairly busy with multiple tables
column8: although she was certainly doing her best with the situation.\nStill

author: N Busch
text: 'Delivery was fast and food was delicious. Sliders and wings were tasty and the elote was excellent.'

author: anju malik
text: 'Hi
column5: I visited the Jersey city location this Saturday with family and Friends. Waiting time after placing the order to get the food was 45mins. And got only partial order. Reminded the staff about partial order and waited for another 15mins. But My food never arrived. Asked them to cancel the order and the staff just said‚Äùsure‚Äù no Apologies for the delay or even no effort to check why it took 1hour. Very unprofessional and Rude service.'

author: Sandra R
text: 'Was there yesterday & ended up leaving
column5: why... long wait & not many customers
column6: the waitress doesnt know the order in which the customers arrive & sit (since you seat yourself) & lastly my drink was served in a dirty glass
column7: when i mentioned it the the bartender she basically didnt do anything so we left.  Low class place
column8: dirty & would not recommend even if it were free food/drinks.  Poor management & staff!!'

author: Darshan Choudhary
text: 'Good pub with nice service and a great selection of drinks. Definitely one of the good places to hang around jersey city for a group'

author: Florence McFadden
text: 'This place never disappoints in terms of beer. They have a wide selection'

author: Jeremy s
text: 'Decent bar but a little pricey on drinks.'

author: Charlie Rocks
text: 'Keegan is the man!!! Thanks for entertaining us with your ghostly magic trick! Awesome spot!!!'

author: Des KF
text: "I was supposed to take clients to this restaurant and spoke to the floor manager about it ghe week prior. They had a policy saying I had to put down $80 which my company wouldn't allow just in case I had to cancel. The floor manager
column5: a lady I forgot her name but it starts with an R
column6: told me to come in a little before my party and they would be able to accommodate me because it was slower on Mondays. So I came early today as she said and they are closed. I called and spoke to I guess the manager and he said oh its only for take out today and we didn't have you down. I told him what I was told and he wasn't too pleasant and told me to go to another spot down the street. Smh for false information."

author: Ken Mallard
text: 'One of a kind. Rooftop is where its at'

author: Bender JC
text: 'Good selection of beer and food. Friendly staff.'

author: Roberto Simbana
text: 'Had fun while visiting Iron Monkey
column5: great place to go and hang out with friends and have a beer. Multiple floors but the roof top was the best
column6: you have your own clear bubble to hang out with friends .I will definitely be coming back in the day time so I can enjoy the views more!'

author: Jey B
text: "Iron Monkey is super chill... Great service and good drinks... I first discovered her when I took the ferry from NYC on my commute home.... Go there! You'll love it!\n\nI've said my piece. Amen!"

author: Rajarshi Choudhury
text: 'Perfect for a weekend evening over brunch with a group of friends
column5: or a date. Intimate setting
column6: good food and excellent service'

author: Lav Ram
text: 'The rooftop is amazing especially in the sunshine. The food is and drinks are great. Good vibes for a small or large groups'

author: Kanchi Chandwani
text: 'I love coming here. The beers are pretty nice and the shots are super strong. I‚Äôll definitely be back here for some beers after work.'

author: Akshit Kapoor
text: 'Poor service
column5: pathetic/ almost inedible food and maybe at best average ambiance. We weren‚Äôt even offered water
column6: had to walk to the wait staff to get utensils and none pof us even finished more than 30% of our food because it was so bad. Looking for a sliver lining at this place but really struggling.'

author: Ankur Patel
text: 'Why are people smoking on the rooftop ( under the same tent) during a pandemic???'

author: Mark Gomes
text: 'Great beer selection
column5: nice food..friendly service.'

author: Mesfin Hagos
text: 'To  Pricey'

author: Vivian/Agustin Lopez
text: 'delightful! Love it here! Had our first date
column5: our wedding  and all of our anniversary dinners there. The owner is a gem and the cook amazing  along with the servers.'

author: Ryan Abernethy
text: 'Staff was extremely friendly'

author: Luis Ml Arthur V
text: 'Very interesting place!!'

author: Vatsal Popat
text: 'Would have given five stars but they stopped keeping whiteclaws in stock for no reason. Been a regular since three years and can‚Äôt believe they just won‚Äôt keep a super popular drink
column5: while they used to all these time. Insane'

author: Sonam Dudani
text: "Very disappointed with the service and the food. We ordered a sangria and a plate of nachos. I'm not sure what drink they served me
column5: it was not sangria. The nachos were cold and the cheese on it was dry. There was no chicken in it like we asked
column6: the guac wasn't fresh. The server offered to replace it
column7: we waited for an hour for it but they never brought it out. So we left and ordered takeout from another place instead."

author: Irina Korotkova
text: 'Went there last Sunday
column5: February 14th
column6: to get some food. At first
column7: we\'ve waited at the entrance doors for somebody to seat us for about 7 minutes. No one paid any attention. When we loudly said "Hello!"
column8: one of the servers asked us to wait a minute and then told us to get any table on the second floor. We\'ve waited for somebody to come for 15 more minutes
column9: but no one showed up. In the room with us was just one couple with some drinks
column10: so I don\'t know the reason. Plenty of workers passed by during that time without noticing us. We left without being served. Seeing how many people had the waiting problems at this place
column11: I also decided to write a review
column12: so the management can maybe adjust the way  clients are being served.'

author: Elvis Meleka
text: 'Ordered on Grubhub 2 guacamole burgers
column5: onion rings and the wings. The issue with the burgers was one of the orders was completely messed up. They just gave my girlfriend a beef patty and buns nothing else at all. They did not include the sauce for the onion rings
column6: so that ruined the point of even having onion rings. My burger I asked for honey mustard on the side and didn‚Äôt get anything. The burger was average
column7: nothing special at all but I had no choice to eat it since I was starving. The wings were decent
column8: nothing much I can say bad about them. Overall not going to be a returning customer and this is my personal experience with this restaurant.'

author: Pamela H
text: "Poor customer service skills
column5: high drink prices
column6: smells really bad
column7: beers on tap taste like there's a dead mouse stuck in the line or keg."

author: Vance Gillenwater
text: "Great neighborhood bar that's been around for years. Multi-level indoor seating options with outdoor seating in igloos on the top floor.  It's now open to 2am on the weekend.  Wear masks to get seated."

author: Nicole Dash
text: 'My friends and I wanted to try this local spot and thought it would be great. Upon entering and asking for a table
column5: we were told ‚Äúno
column6: absolutely not‚Äù as if we were not of the stature of dining at the establishment. After double checking her reservations
column7: the hostess informed us a bubble outside was available. I understand that with limited seating and
column8: as we were informed
column9: there was only once chef so the kitchen was backed up. Our appetizers and food were meant to come out separately
column10: but ending up taking about an hour and 10 minutes and all the food came out at once. The food arrived barely warm. The waitress
column11: after being informed the food was not hot
column12: told us she would speak with the manager. 15 minutes later an irate man approached and came into our bubble
column13: without a mask covering his face
column14: and proceeded to scream at us that we were being too difficult and that we should understand they‚Äôre backed up. And yes
column16: but we hadn‚Äôt expected some tater tots and a soft pretzel to take over an hour to make. The manager
column17: after getting blue in the face from yelling and finally letting us speak
column18: heard our concerns with the food temperature
column20: and the fact that we had not even gotten napkins or water. After him hearing us out
column21: he handled getting us napkins and water and the hostess even came out and apologized. But to be quite frank
column22: as someone who has worked in food service and has a bachelors degree revolving around food and food service
column23: I am honestly appalled by how I was spoken to by the OWNER of this establishment and will not be dining here again.'

author: Thomas Rogers
text: 'custom tables and chairs. good beer selection. 4 floors including roof of seating. call ahead to verify hours during covid 19.'

author: Amanpreet Saini
text: 'Literally being the only 2 people on the rooftop our food took 50 minutes. When the food arrived it was cold. No one came to check on us to see if we were satisfied or if everything was ok. No waiters in sight to say anything . No one to take a drink order. So we have 30 minutes to eat cold food and on top of that they didn‚Äôt even bring everything we ordered to the table. So here we are from 645 pm to 758 pm; cold food
column5: one drink. Telling us 90 minutes and a 80$ minimum. How? Oh and yea still no one !'

author: Bre TH
text: 'Hair was on our glass and napkin and the manager came to talk to us about it and he just grabbed the hair off the napkin and said he was sorry about that. He didn‚Äôt even try to get us a fresh napkin. The beer was good but they came in tiny glasses and they don‚Äôt fill them all the way up. Food was ok but not seasoned. The waitress was really nice about all the problems we were having but I just wish the manager would have done something to compensate for the hair we kept finding. We spent almost 100 dollars and was disappointed. Won‚Äôt be returning.'

author: Stephanie Lamb
text: 'They are doing COVID dining much more responsibly than any other restaurant ove been too with temperature checks and spacing out when people can ak through the restaurant. The igloos are fun to dine in.'

author: John McMahon
text: 'Great little spot with tasty drinks and food. They have an expansive roof deck with heated "pods" available for CoViD compliant drinking/dining. Pods are also available for sidewalk fun.'

author: Jeska Padilla
text: 'Very clean rooftop bar
column5: drinks were yummy and service was very friendly.'

author: Anu Jain
text: 'V casual.and fun'

author: Birnalisi Baez Dosili
text: 'üëçüëçüëçüëç'

author: Dan Frohwirth
text: 'Great food & drink & service
column5: as usual!'

author: Israel Cobos Robles
text: 'The rooftop is the best part of this place'

author: Sean C. Koop
text: "Iron Monkey is a really nice craft beer bar to go too. Their rooftop is amazing and provides a great view. We went there on a cold day and they offer small clear through tents you can sit in. They provide a heater in it which unfortunately keeps you not so warm. I recommend to ensure to have warm clothes if you sit outside.\n\nThey have a great variety of different beers. As a craft beer enthusiast you will find a lot of great options. They offer a six beer flight
column5: which let you taste a lot.\n\nThe food was ok. Their food menu is huge and you will find a lot of different possibilities. The vegan / vegetarian options were a little less then at other places I've been to. I would check out the menu beforehand to see if you find something for you
column6: if you don't eat meat.\n\nThe service was all the time great and friendly."

author: Akanksha Shelke
text: 'Very friendly bar tender.. and nice ambience with rooftop as well as out door sitting options available.. loved it!'

author: Savannah Apple
text: 'Drinks were great and the menu had so much to choose from. Enjoy the roof while you can before I gets cold!'

author: Alyssa W.
text: 'For a ‚Äúquarantine rooftop‚Äù this was perfect on a warm Saturday. They have individual plastic pods you can sit in. The chicken wings were amazing (Thai chili). The nachos were a little dry but the shrimp on them was good. Drinks were great. I‚Äôd go back. Not sure how long the outside pods will be a thing but they did the trick!'

author: Stephen Wiggs
text: 'Went with a few friends. Great vibe and a good beer selection. Will be back for sure!'

author: Christina Perez
text: 'I visited this place for the first time a month ago and i can truly say it was a horrible experience. The service was terrible. Servers with attitudes. The food was burnt and had no flavor. The marinara sauce was bland and tasteless
column5: the spaghetti was hard. my bf had a burger with english muffins for buns. Are you kidding me? Lol. The fries were spongy. Whomever is cooking this food should be ashamed for thinking they know how to cook. There is no love in that kitchen. NEVER AGAIN. Giving 1 star is too generous'

author: Lindsay Owen
text: "I frequented Iron Monkey pre-COVID often and was so happy when they reopened for delivery back in the spring. Along with your delivery order
column5: they provide utensils
column6: napkins
column7: etc. in a sanitary plastic ziploc bag. I've recently started going back to Iron Monkey for their outdoor dining and the staff continues to impress me with their efforts to keep customers safe. I highly recommend treating yourself to the seafood pasta on the rooftop!"

text: "Venue (2/5) For a rooftop
column5:
the view is unfortunately blocked by taller nearby buildings and most of the seating isn't conducive to giving a good view.

Food and drinks (2/5): The drinks are not particularly amazing. We ordered chips and salsa but there was much too few chips and too much salsa.

Service (5/5): Staff was nice

text: "Stella was flat. Bartender saw it after the pour and still served it. After I pointed out the obvious

column6: there are better options. If you like flat beer

Customers should not be treated like this.'

text: 'The food took long to make
column5: and somehow it was cold and burned at the same time. The chef definitely needs some training or time management skills. The beer I ordered was totally different than what I got
column6: tasted like a mixture of stale coffee and cheap beer. I can honestly say
column7: this was the worst food I ever had in my life...no joking. Now I can understand why it was only us in this place and no one else. There is more to write but honestly I want to forget I ate here.'

text: "Bar was pretty empty for a Sunday afternoon with football on TV screens. Rooftop bar wasn't open. The beers on tap were not the best tasting. One tasted flat & seemed like they didn't clear/clean their tap line. The stout I had on tap also wasn't the greatest either. Had a weird aftertaste and the beers were flat. Glasses also didn't seem to be too clean.. I've had better elsewhere. Also their food menu has minimized and less options to choose from compared to a few years back."

author: Tom Reed
text: 'Went on a Monday night
column5: and was told most of the plentiful draft list had kicked. When we finally settled on a Bell‚Äôs they said they had
column6: they came back and told us ‚ÄúOops. Kicked too.‚Äù  The cheese fondue I ordered was cold
column7: and the consistency of cheddar soup. The other two entr√©es we ordered weren‚Äôt much better. The only highlight was a very nice waiter

text: 'This is a pub that is open until late on weekdays.  It is not a specialty restaurant

author: Kevin Wesselink
text: 'Google and their own website lists them open at 11.  I called ahead to make sure they‚Äôre actually not open until 1:00. Show up at 1:05pm and place is closed. Nobody picks up- seems unprofessional'

author: Craig Shankman
text: "The monkey.  Ah yes the monkey.  I have been going to the monkey for a long time as I go back and forth on business to Jersey City.  The monkey is a classic bar.  It's friendly most nights
column5: smelly some nights
column6: comfy some nights
column7: but no matter what the day
column8: the crowd will be eclectic.  Some people like the rooftop
column9: but I was never a huge fan
column10: I like the smaller more intimate bar on the second floor.  The food is mostly good most days. The monkey is a jersey city staple now.  Other bars have opened in the area and they are all nicer
column11: better organized and have better food
column12: but they all lack the charm of the monkey."

author: Saurabh Suman
text: 'Visited last week on a hot day
column5: air conditioning was not working and drinks were not made so well...'

author: Chris Andrews
text: "Overpriced
column5: poor girl left behind the bar to work on her own
column6: didn't know where a lot of things were but kept smiling....\n\nI had Crispin Cider
column7: which we realised when it was finished was out of date. Didn't want to put the lone barmaid in a difficult position
column8: so let her serve people
column9: selling our of date drinks would seem like bad planning by the ownership...."

author: Lisa Davie
text: "Love that they have Lindemans Framboise on tap
column5: will defiantly be back when I'm in town."

text: 'Some good things and some bad things. Rooftop is cute. Food is mediocre and service is lackluster. Bartender downstairs is great and a wonderful beer selection. Would give 3.5 stars if I could but rounded down.'

text: 'Warm and friendly bar in the middle of a business district. Had a mix up with my credit card but staff was very apologetic and went above and beyond to make sure my food

text: 'Food is excellentüëåüèæ'

author: Werner Contreras
text: "This bar/restaurant will accommodate whatever your mood is. The first floor is a traditional sports bar
column5: the second floor is a restaurant with occasional live music and the roof is kind of a combo of the two with excellent vibes. Great selection of beers and a decent menu. It appears the menu has been scaled down significantly in the last 6 months but it's still quality food. Overall you'd be hard pressed to find a better place to have a few drinks in Jersey City."
